metadata.title: CVE-2024-42273 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:f2fs: assign CURSEG_ALL_DATA_ATGC if blkaddr is validmkdir /mnt/test/compf2fs_io setflags compression /mnt/test/compdd if=/dev/zero of=/mnt/test/comp/testfile bs=16k count=1truncate --size 13 /mnt/test/comp/testfileIn the above scenario, we can get a BUG_ON. kernel BUG at fs/f2fs/segment.c:3589! Call Trace:  do_write_page+0x78/0x390 [f2fs]  f2fs_outplace_write_data+0x62/0xb0 [f2fs]  f2fs_do_write_data_page+0x275/0x740 [f2fs]  f2fs_write_single_data_page+0x1dc/0x8f0 [f2fs]  f2fs_write_multi_pages+0x1e5/0xae0 [f2fs]  f2fs_write_cache_pages+0xab1/0xc60 [f2fs]  f2fs_write_data_pages+0x2d8/0x330 [f2fs]  do_writepages+0xcf/0x270  __writeback_single_inode+0x44/0x350  writeback_sb_inodes+0x242/0x530  __writeback_inodes_wb+0x54/0xf0  wb_writeback+0x192/0x310  wb_workfn+0x30d/0x400The reason is we gave CURSEG_ALL_DATA_ATGC to COMPR_ADDR where thepage was set the gcing flag by set_cluster_dirty().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42273` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
